refnamediv.refname: X509_get_version, X509_set_version, X509_REQ_get_version, X509_REQ_set_version, X509_CRL_get_version, X509_CRL_set_version
refnamediv.refpurpose: get or set certificate, certificate request or CRL version.

refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: long X509_get_version(X509 *x); int X509_set_version(X509 *x, long version);
long X509_REQ_get_version(X509_REQ *req); int X509_REQ_set_version(X509_REQ *x, long version);
long X509_CRL_get_version(X509_CRL *crl); int X509_CRL_set_version(X509_CRL *x, long version);

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: X509_get_version() returns the numerical value of the version field of certificate x. Note: this is defined by standards (X.509 et al) to be one less than the certificate version. So a verson 3 certificate will return 2 and a version 1 certificate will return 0.
X509_set_version() sets the numerical value of the version field of certificate x to version.
Similarly X509_REQ_get_version(), X509_REQ_set_version(), X509_CRL_get_version() and X509_CRL_set_version() get and set the version number of certificate requests and CRLs.

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: The version field of certificates, certificate requests and CRLs has a DEFAULT value of v1(0) meaning the field should be omitted for version 1. This is handled transparently by these functions.

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: X509_get_version(), X509_REQ_get_version() and X509_CRL_get_version() return the numerical value of the version field.
X509_set_version(), X509_REQ_set_version() and X509_CRL_set_version() return 1 for success and 0 for failure.

refsection.title: SEE ALSO
refsection.para: d2i_X509 3 , ERR_get_error 3 , X509_CRL_get0_by_serial 3 , X509_get0_signature 3 , X509_get_ext_d2i 3 , X509_get_extension_flags 3 , X509_get_pubkey 3 , X509_get_subject_name 3 , X509_NAME_add_entry_by_txt 3 , X509_NAME_ENTRY_get_object 3 , X509_NAME_get_index_by_NID 3 , X509_NAME_print_ex 3 , X509_new 3 , X509_sign 3 , X509V3_get_d2i 3 , X509_verify_cert 3

refsection.title: HISTORY
refsection.para: X509_get_version(), X509_set_version() X509_REQ_get_version(), X509_REQ_set_version(), X509_REQ_get_version() and X509_REQ_set_version() are available in all versions of OpenSSL.
X509_get_version(), X509_REQ_get_version() and X509_CRL_get_version() are functions in OpenSSL 1.1.0, in previous versions they were macros.
